page.title: 05EDUCATION IN SELSEY
page.content: Seal and Medmerry County Primary Schools give Selsey Children their introduction to learning.Both admit pupils from 5-10 years.Each of these schools has around 200 children and very pleasant surroundings.There is very good contact between Medmerry and Seal school and the Community College where children attend from 10-16, in School Lane,Selsey.The Manhood Community College offers facilities to both children and adults during school time and in the evenings.Some children come from Selsey and some come from the surrounding areas of the two Primary Schools.Medmerry was Built in 1905 when it was used as an Infant School.In 1938 Medmerry became an Infant and Junior School.Seal School was built in 1936.
